Revision.description:
The revision number of the configuration.

`1`

Id.description:
The ID of the Amazon MQ configuration.

`c-1234a5b6-78cd-901e-2fgh-3i45j6k178l9`

Arn.description:
The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the Amazon MQ configuration.

`arn:aws:mq:us-east-2:123456789012:configuration:MyConfigurationDevelopment:c-1234a5b6-78cd-901e-2fgh-3i45j6k178l9`

Key.description: The key in a key-value pair.

Value.description: The value in a key-value pair.

TagsEntry.description: A key-value pair to associate with the configuration.

description:
Creates a new configuration for the specified configuration name. Amazon MQ uses the default configuration (the engine type and version).

> Does not apply to RabbitMQ brokers.

AuthenticationStrategy.description: Optional. The authentication strategy associated with the configuration. The default is `SIMPLE` .

EngineType.description: The type of broker engine. Note: Currently, Amazon MQ only supports ACTIVEMQ for creating and editing broker configurations.

EngineVersion.description: The version of the broker engine. For a list of supported engine versions, see [](https://docs.aws.amazon.com/amazon-mq/latest/developer-guide/broker-engine.html)

Name.description: The name of the configuration. This value can contain only alphanumeric characters, dashes, periods, underscores, and tildes (- . _ ~). This value must be 1-150 characters long.

Tags.description: Create tags when creating the configuration.
